intro: Galium sichuanense, commonly known as the Sichuan bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in summer, followed by small, three-lobed berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
